subject: Design
subcategory: Famous Logos and Their Hidden Stories
title: Mastercard's Wordless Rebrand
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Mastercard's Wordless Rebrand.

hook.text: In 2019, Mastercard removed its name from the logo. Just two overlapping circles remained.

buildup.text: The red and yellow Venn diagram had been their mark since 1966. It was already iconic enough.

discovery.text: Research showed that 80% of people recognized the circles without any text at all.

twist.text: Dropping the name saved space on smartwatches, payment terminals, and tiny screens everywhere.

climax.text: Mastercard joined Nike, Apple, and Starbucks in the exclusive club of wordless logos.

punchline.text: You've truly made it when your name is optional.

quiz.question: Why did Mastercard remove its name from the logo?
